revised_title: Chemical Heterogeneity in the Earth's Mantle: Trace Element Evidence from the Scottish Midland Valley
tldr: This article investigates the chemical heterogeneity in the Earth's mantle using trace element evidence from the Carboniferous and Permian rocks in the Scottish Midland Valley. The authors found that the mantle sources of alkaline rocks had distinct trace element compositions, suggesting that these rocks originated from different mantle sources. This study provides insights into the complex processes of magma genesis and the evolution of the Earth's mantle.
